sources.name: Bolt of Frostweave
sources.comments: 5 Frostweave Cloth per Bolt

sources.name: Bolt of Imbued Frostweave
sources.comments: 2 Bolts of Frostweave, 2 Infinite Dust per Imbued Bolt

sources.name: Ebonweave
sources.comments: 4 day cooldown. Requires the Obsidian Dragonshrine. Specialised tailors again make two instead of one. Shadoweave Tailors are automatically grandfathered into Ebonweave!

sources.name: Any Tailoring supplier
sources.comments: Any supplier will provide you with this. Don't you think it's weird that every tailor, some of whom never left Northrend, quickly adapted to using threads made of a metal that only occurs in Outland?

sources.name: Virtually any humanoid / undead in Northrend
sources.comments: Pick any target you can comfortably kill and go to town. Highly skilled Tailors can learn to scavenge significantly more cloth when they loot a monster.

sources.name: Reinforced Crate
sources.comments: Comes from any swarm of fish, ironically enough. Has an average of 5 Cloth 11% of the time.

sources.name: Abandoned Adventurer's Satchel
sources.comments: Guaranteed drop from any rare mob which seems to always contain a 20 stack of cloth. Decent enough, but they're by definition hard to find and can be quite tough.

sources.name: Dread Creeper, Venom Stalker, Carrion Spinner
sources.comments: Just as they obsoleted silk demand in Classic so do I expect will they do again. Your guild will likely provide these freely.

sources.name: Trapdoor Crawler
sources.comments: In contrast to the Trapdoor Ambusher to the south, not relevant to any quest, can freely be spawned, and is only an annoyance to average people.

sources.name: Crystalweb Spiders
sources.comments: Relevant to one quest, but plentiful.

sources.name: Trapdoor Ambusher
sources.comments: Only spawn by interacting during the daily quest Troll Patrol: Can You Dig It?, and messing around for long ruins your time for the meta-daily.

sources.name: Moonshroud
sources.comments: 4 day cooldown. Requires the Emerald Dragonshrine. Specialised tailors again make two instead of one. Mooncloth Tailors are automatically grandfathered into Moonshroud!

sources.name: Spellweave
sources.comments: 4 day cooldown. Requires the Azure Dragonshrine. Specialised tailors again make two instead of one. Spellfire Tailors are automatically grandfathered into Spellweave!

sources.name: Enraged Tempest
sources.comments: Hyperspawn, compact, easy to kill, give movement speed buff on kill. What's not to like.

sources.name: Scion of Storm
sources.comments: Though quest-relevant, there are dozens of these in a tiny cave including a literal shooting gallery. Their sheer quality makes up for a 25% chance of 1-2 Airs

sources.name: Stormrider
sources.comments: Large area with mobs just about in range of each other. Less compact than Scion of Storm but also plentiful.

sources.name: Tempest Revenant
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Altar Warden
sources.comments: With a little questing, you can turn all mobs here neutral. But there aren't many of these and the quest often requires a full clear, leading to high contention.

sources.name: Ionar
sources.comments: Deep in the dungeon, but has a high chance to drop 6-9 Airs.

sources.name: Titanium Vein
sources.comments: Drops Air, Earth, Fire, or Water.

sources.name: Whispering Wind
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Storm Revenant
sources.comments: Spread out with two-thirds irrelevant mobs, broken up terrain, few spawns, relevant to dailies.

sources.name: Lightning Sentry
sources.comments: Plentiful in compact area, but bad drops and very dangerous due to their 500 dps lightning totems. Avoid.

sources.name: Lifeblood Elemental
sources.comments: Hyperspawn, the terrain isn't too bad if you start at the top and go down.

sources.name: Any ore deposit
sources.comments: Simply mining deposits has a very high chance of getting Motes, giving more the higher level the deposit is. I expect this will inject a lot of Earth naturally.

sources.name: Earthbound Revenant
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Any minable NPC
sources.comments: Reason number 2 why paying a miner for Earth is secretly the best farming technique. Higher-level and elite mobs drop more, but it's all about equal.

sources.name: Iron Rune Golem, Rampaging Earth Elemental
sources.comments: Do not fight on the scaffolding where many iron dwarves will fight the elementals and you. Instead be down in the plain or in the cave where there is nothing but concentrated Earth droppers. Golems have better drops than Elementals but both are good.

sources.name: Runic Battle Golem
sources.comments: Plenty in a small area and about 80% are engaged with friendly earthen dwarves that will not kill them.

sources.name: Brittle Revenant
sources.comments: Relevant to a Sons of Hodir daily. Plenty in a small area, but high level and bad odds.

sources.name: Sholazar Guardian
sources.comments: Very quick respawns and a total of 10 mobs in the area, though in an indoors tunnel and sharing space with the elite Overlook Sentry. Quest-relevant. Plausible hyperspawn.

sources.name: Guardian of Zim'Rhuk
sources.comments: Decent odds of up to 4 Crystallized Earth, but only 10 in a small area. Plausible hyperspawn.

sources.name: Runic War Golem
sources.comments: If you can fly, you can mostly fight only golems, otherwise a lot of stuff is in the way. Plausible Hyperspawn.

sources.name: Chilled Earth Elemental
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Perch Guardian
sources.comments: Seven total spawns in specific spots with bad drop odds.

sources.name: Overlook Sentry
sources.comments: A single elite patrols in a circle where Sholazar Guardians may be found. Even if someone is questing, they are unlikely to kill it. But bad drops.

sources.name: Stormwatcher
sources.comments: I was able to spot a total of four intermixed with air and water elementals. Not worth doing.

sources.name: The Anvil
sources.comments: Quest-relevant in a building surrounded by iron dwarves, tougher than normal elites of his level, and has a friend. Not meant to be killed normally.

sources.name: Wailing Winds
sources.comments: Hyperspawn, bundled together in a tiny cave. A quest takes place there but does not involve them directly. Yes, they drop fire, not air.

sources.name: Raging Boiler
sources.comments: Hyperspawn, compact, easy to kill

sources.name: Seething Revenant
sources.comments: Relevant to a Sons of Hodir daily. Plenty in a small area, but high level and bad odds. You will be phased out of seeing these for some time between the initial quests and unlocking their related daily.

sources.name: Titanium Vein
sources.comments: Passive income like Motes of Earth. Important: Mining anything but these does not give any Fire, including mining mobs.

sources.name: Flame Revenant
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. There are three total spawns of these up at once.

sources.name: Unbound Firestorm
sources.comments: The dungeon contains a fair amount of these and while the odds aren't amazing, it's an okay source per run.

sources.name: Raging Flame
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Lord Everblaze
sources.comments: One of three possible dailies at the tournament is to kill him, and his drop chances are terrible. Don't.

sources.name: Any herb
sources.comments: Like with Earth and miners, the best source of these are herbalists. They just passively generate them.

sources.name: Thornvine Creeper
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn. I never ran out of mobs in retail. Very low level and thus easy to kill while sporting competitive drop chances.

sources.name: Servant of Freya
sources.comments: Randomly patrols through an area with many hostile beasts, but has good odds and no notable drops beyond Life and herbs.

sources.name: Mature Lasher
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. I counted thirteen spawns, however, making these not the worst source.

sources.name: Living Lasher
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. One or two is next to each Mature Lasher, but they do not seem to be social.

sources.name: Corrupted Lothalor Ancient
sources.comments: Being below Living Lasher says everything. I only found three at once, and while they can be comfortably soloed, their net drops are barely above other life-dropping mobs. Only the ones not currently being corrupted (Symbols swirling above head) can be attacked.

sources.name: Woodlands Walker
sources.comments: IF you are on the quest, you can request they give you bark. This may have them attack you or give it to you and despawn. Since you only need 3, this is a very involved method for basically no gain over other farms.

sources.name: Ancient Watcher
sources.comments: There may be up to 3 up at a time, and they're not hard to kill. Their average drop is equal to other mobs, however. So don't bother.

sources.name: Mossy Rampager
sources.comments: NOT a hyperspawn! Completing Pa'troll tends to require killing most of these, they are interspersed with annoying basilisks that are social with them, and their drop rates suck.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: The odds aren't great, but it's a good bonus to killing them. Just about all of them also naturally drop life and have good odds to drop actual herbs when gathered.

sources.name: Deathbringer Revenant
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. Drop rates are about 0.2 shadow per kill. As it's inside of an alliance base, essentially needs flying to get to, but you're safe once inside the cave and you get to ogle at the former site of Frostmourne.

sources.name: Shadow Revenant
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. I counted eleven spawns, which is quite respectable.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit
sources.comments: Odds are pretty bad on regular deposits, but better on Rich ones.

sources.name: Wandering Shadow
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. Seem to accompany Shadow Revenants.

sources.name: Boiling Water Spirit
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. The counterpart to Enraged Tempest and Raging Boiler. Concentrated, low level, hyper. Note the only difference between this and the following hyperspawn entries is navigability and difficulty-to-kill.

sources.name: Ice Elemental
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. Very plentiful in a tiny area and low level.

sources.name: Ice Revenant
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. I don't see any way these are relevant to quests, but it may be something opaque. Still, concentrated, low-ish level.

sources.name: Frozen Elemental
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn. They are simply so plentiful, spilling into Dragonblight, that even if they are not a hyperspawn you will have no trouble getting some.

sources.name: Frozen Earth
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. Seemingly higher odds than other mobs, though higher level, and still packed and isolated.

sources.name: Icebound Revenant
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn. Themselves not quest-related, but guard a mob that is. As with Frozen Elemental, they appeared to hyperspawn in retail, and at any rate you will have no problem constantly farming while they are not overly crowded.

sources.name: Crazed Water Spirit
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. Need to die in large quantities for one-time quest.

sources.name: Corrupted Rager
sources.comments: Hyperspawn. Very underwater and tough to navigate, but anyone with ranged attacks should have little difficutly.

sources.name: Water Revenant
sources.comments: Only visible if your faction holds Wintergrasp. Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch. They are easier to pick up on the western side and do not spawn in the south water (where air and earth spawn), but there should be no need to ever kill these.

sources.name: Glacial Spirit
sources.comments: Drop rates are pretty bad, plus they are in a mandatory PvP zone and pack a good punch.

sources.name: Titanium Deposit
sources.comments: Drops Air, Earth, Fire, or Water.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit
sources.comments: Not great, but passive income.

sources.name: Iceshard Elemental
sources.comments: NOT a hyperspawn! Likely to be farmed by innocent questers, but note there are plenty in the eastern hills, not just the glacier.

sources.name: Crystalline Ice Elemental
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn. But honestly, don't bother. They are very spread, always mixed with other mobs, and don't have notably better drops.

sources.name: Aqeous Spirit
sources.comments: High-level, mixed with other mobs, daily quest relevant, spread.

sources.name: Any school of fish
sources.comments: Only passive income while fishing for the fish of which the school is.

sources.name: Any water
sources.comments: No. Barely at odds worth mentioning.

sources.name: Crystallized Air
sources.comments: Combining crystallized parts is going to account for 90% of Eternals.

sources.name: Transmute: Eternal Earth to Air
sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.name: Transmute: Eternal Water to Air
sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.name: Frozo the Renowned
sources.comments: One Orb for an Eternal. If you have nothing better to do with them...

sources.comments: Combining crystallized parts is going to account for 90% of Eternals.

sources.name: Transmute: Eternal Air to Earth
sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.comments: One Orb for an Eternal. If you have nothing better to do with them...

sources.comments: Combining crystallized parts is going to account for 90% of Eternals.

sources.name: Transmute: Eternal Air to Water
sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.comments: 20 hour cooldown. Must be discovered. An alchemist specialised in transmutation produces on average 20% more product. See transmute graph on your screen right now.

sources.name: Frozo the Renowned
sources.comments: One Orb for an Eternal. If you have nothing better to do with them...

sources.name: Any Wrath epic
sources.comments: Unlike prior iterations, it seems Abyss Crystals will never be disenchanted from blue items.

sources.name: High level Wrath blues
sources.comments: Blue items with item level 167 - 200 (requires level 72 - 80.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Small Dream Shard
sources.comments: 3 into 1. Unlike earlier iterations, this can be done freely by anyone, but you cannot reverse the process even with Enchanting, because Small Dream Shards serve literally no purpose other than making regular shards.

sources.name: High level Wrath greens
sources.comments: 3% chance to be disenchanted from item level 152 - 200 greens (requires level 72 - 80.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Lesser Cosmic Essence
sources.comments: 3 into 1 just like all essences. Anyone can do this.

sources.name: High level Wrath greens
sources.comments: Green items with item level 152 - 200 (requires level 73 - 80.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Abyssal Shatter
sources.comments: Converts one Abyss Crystal into an average of 9.25 Infinite Dust (33% chance) or 2.78 Greater Cosmic Essence (66% chance)

sources.name: Any Wrath green
sources.comments: Green items with item level 130 - 200 (required level 67 - 80.) Items below level 152 drop 2-3, above drop 4-7. See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Abyssal Shatter
sources.comments: Converts one Abyss Crystal into an average of 9.25 Infinite Dust (33% chance) or 2.78 Greater Cosmic Essence (66% chance)

sources.name: Low level Wrath greens
sources.comments: Green items with item level 130 - 151 (requires level 67 - 72.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Greater Cosmic Essence
sources.comments: 1 into 3 just like all essences. Anyone can do this.

sources.name: Runed Titanium Rod
sources.comments: In addition to the obvious Titanium Rod, also requires 40 Infinite Dust, 12 Greater Cosmic Essences, 8 Large Dream Shards, and your trusty Eternium Rod.

sources.name: Low level Wrath blues
sources.comments: Blue items with item level 130 - 166 (requires level 69 - 77.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Low level Wrath greens
sources.comments: 3% chance to be disenchanted from item level 130 - 151 greens (requires level 69 - 77.) See table, data credit to Goodwinn on Wowhead.

sources.name: Titanium Rod
sources.comments: Crafted by your favorite blacksmith out of two Saronite Bars and a Titanium Bar.

sources.name: Sholazar Basin
sources.comments: Not terribly useful and very plentiful, this should be one of the easier herbs to gather. Grows near other plants.

sources.name: Gundrak
sources.comments: Gundrak contains two Adder's Tongue nodes. One is feasibly stealthable by going past the Den of Sseratus just inside the northwestern entrance. The node spawns either side of the water after leaving the Den, which you can do without slaying Sseratus. The other node is only found on Heroic, entering the cave on the west side of the Cave of Mam'toth after slaying Moorabi.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Drak'tharon Keep
sources.comments: Two nodes of Adder's Tongue spawn in the raptor pens. It's plausible to stealth through and grab one, but given the spawn locations and various sizes of dinosaur in the area, getting both is likely impossible, may even get none.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: Very insignificant drop chance for anything in particular.

sources.name: Other plants
sources.comments: Random additional drop from Frost Lotus, Goldclover, Talandra's Rose, or Tiger Lily.

sources.name: Borean Tundra
sources.comments: On the edge of them steam pools. It serves no purpose other than milling, so it should be the major pressure on ink prices.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Any Wrath herb
sources.comments: Gather anything and good fortune will come to you.

sources.name: Frozo the Renowned
sources.comments: A Lotus for an Orb.

sources.name: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: While pure nodes exist, don't expect to find any other than by happening to stand on their spawn point.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Howling Fjord
sources.comments: Likes to grow in areas where other herbs wouldn't: Plains some distance from water. Almost all nodes are on the high ground of the cliffs and many follow the roads.

sources.name: Grizzly Hills
sources.comments: Likes to grow in areas where other herbs wouldn't: Plains some distance from water. Forms two distinct groups, one in the western lowlands and one forming a distant semi-circle around Camp Oneqwah.

sources.name: Borean Tundra
sources.comments: Likes to grow in areas where other herbs wouldn't: Plains some distance from water. Spawns in Borean Tundra are quite spread and you must pass through hostile terrain, making a fast flying mount highly recommended.

sources.name: Sholazar Basin
sources.comments: Likes to grow in areas where other herbs wouldn't: Plains some distance from water. Farming specifically Goldclover in Sholazar Basin is inefficient as it doesn't spawn in half the zone, but you can pick other herbs as you go.

sources.name: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Only grows in the red and green dragon shrine in Dragonblight, as only they offer its preferred terrain.

sources.name: Azjol-Nerub
sources.comments: One node spawns after Hadronox before the drop, one after. Impractical to stealth and to solo as it requires defeating two bosses.

sources.name: Ahn'Kahet
sources.comments: Prince Taldaram must be dead to gather this. Found in Amanitar's area, where groups usually don't go. However, gathering after a regular instance run is plausible if you can kill singular elites.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Only found in the higher, snow-covered tiers of Zul'Drak.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Grows near other vegetation, so not found in the middle third of the zone.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Since it's not usually why people come to Wintergrasp, should be easy to find.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: The Nexus
sources.comments: It is plausible to pick two nodes in the garden area to the right of the entrance with stealth, but it would probably require slaying some trash.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: Very insignificant drop chance for anything in particular.

sources.name: Storm Peaks
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Lichbloom. Grows on snow and ice, so everywhere.

sources.name: Icecrown
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Lichbloom. Grows on snow and ice, but also the lowlands of Icecrown.

sources.name: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Lichbloom. Grows on snow and ice, so everywhere.

sources.name: Utgarde Pinnacle
sources.comments: Found on the outside balconies (even though the Fjord isn't cold enough in that area?) Stealth is impractical at best as each node has a trash pack and/or a Skadi on it and the dungeon is high level even on normal

sources.name: The Oculus
sources.comments: Found on the Band of Transmutation, where the third boss Mage-Lord Urom resides. It is plausible to grab most of if not all possible spawns without killing any more than the first boss. Make sure to check the inner ring too.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: Very insignificant drop chance for anything in particular.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Storm Peaks
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Icethorn. Grows on snow and ice, so everywhere.

sources.name: Icecrown
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Icethorn. Grows on snow and ice, but also the lowlands of Icecrown.

sources.name: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Seems to share spawns with Icethorn. Grows on snow and ice, so everywhere.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: Very insignificant drop chance for anything in particular.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Grows near stone.

sources.name: Ahn'kahet
sources.comments: Guarded by trash, but near the entrance and does not require killing a boss. If you can clear a pack, you can grab this.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Only found in the higher, snow-covered tiers of Zul'Drak.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Grows near other vegetation, so not found in the middle third of the zone.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Since it's not usually why people come to Wintergrasp, should be easy to find.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: The Nexus
sources.comments: It is plausible to pick two nodes in the garden area to the right of the entrance.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob
sources.comments: Very insignificant drop chance for anything in particular.

sources.name: Alchemist's Cache
sources.comments: Awarded after defeating Freya, but probably taken by the guild bank or rolled. Her garden also contains many herbs, of which you'll get what you get.

sources.name: Borean Tundra
sources.comments: Since Tiger Lily only spawns on this one lake in Borean Tundra, it gets ALL the spawns. I have personally seen six nodes up at once, reportedly it can go up to seven.

sources.name: Sholazar Basin
sources.comments: Best I could tell, it does not grow anywhere but the marked zones even though the terrain is the same. Regardless, you can hit most nodes on a compact route and grab other plants on the way.

sources.name: Grizzly Hills
sources.comments: Going along the western waterway is recommended for more nodes, but since you have to contend with the terrain and an enemy town it may be a pain without a flying mount. The eastern cluster is less populated but easier especially for horde players. Switching from the west river to the east is of course also possible.

sources.name: Howling Fjord
sources.comments: The Fjord's elevation and wide waterways make this a big pain without flying.

sources.name: Azjol-Nerub
sources.comments: One node spawns in front of the first boss and can plausibly be gathered by slaying a little trash. The second requires killing the first boss and going down the drop.

sources.name: Ahn'kahet
sources.comments: Prince Taldaram must be dead to gather this. Found in Amanitar's area, where groups usually don't go. However, gathering after a regular instance run is plausible if you can kill singular elites.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Only found in the higher, snow-covered tiers of Zul'Drak.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Grows near other vegetation, so not found in the middle third of the zone.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Contains a random node's yield among Goldclover, Tiger Lily, and Talandra's Rose. Since it's not usually why people come to Wintergrasp, should be easy to find.

sources.name: Frozen Herb: The Nexus
sources.comments: It is plausible to pick two nodes in the garden area to the right of the entrance.

sources.name: Any gatherable mob

sources.name: Icy Prism

sources.name: Tiny Titanium Lockbox
sources.comments: Contained in Bag of Fishing Treasures from the fishing daily.

sources.name: Cache of the Ley-Guardian
sources.comments: So funny story. The Oculus is so unpopular that in order to make people not instantly leave when it comes in dungeon finder, you get an extra bag with really good rewards if it is selected as your random dungeon. You need to personally loot it off the final chest. With random dungeon finder not coming to the game, it is unclear whether this item will be available.

sources.name: Braeg Stoutbeard
sources.comments: Sold for 10 Heavy Leather each. Probably the best source in practice.

sources.name: Any skinnable mob
sources.comments: A rare drop from essentially anything in Northrend. Don't be fooled by statistical anomalies in the Wowhead data. The only mobs with notably higher drop chance are raid bosses.

sources.name: Any skinnable mob
sources.comments: Higher level mobs have very slightly better odds and amounts, but the only thing that matters in practice is killing a lot of mobs quickly. As long as you're not in the starting zones, any target will do.

sources.name: Borean Leather Scraps
sources.comments: 5 Scraps create one regular leather. It appears you can do so by just right clicking, but leatherworkers can also do it through the profession window to get points.

sources.name: Any skinnable mob
sources.comments: If you need specifically scraps for some reason, lower level mobs naturally will drop scraps instead of Leather more often.

sources.name: Borean Leather
sources.comments: 5 regular Leather create one Heavy. There is no other source for this.

sources.name: Early Oculus trash
sources.comments: If you can kill the early trash comfortably, all of it has skin that you can take off. Supposedly a lot of classes can do it with pretty low gear requirements. This may make Skinning wholly pointless when bots do it for you.

sources.name: Primordial Drake
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn. The obvious place to farm, but for a reason. Even with contention and questers, this should be best.

sources.name: Stormpeak Wyrm
sources.comments: Plausible Hyperspawn, because quest relevant.

sources.name: Azure Spellweaver
sources.comments: Not really relevant for anything and close to Dalaran.

sources.name: Dragons
sources.comments: There are many more, the above are just a selection of what I expect would be the best sources.

sources.name: Jormungars
sources.comments: Conveniently, you can both skin a lot of Jormungar being killed by daily questers and find them in random caves.

sources.name: Nerubians
sources.comments: Just like there is always a spider within three inches of you, Nerubians are more widespread than you'd think.

sources.name: Open water
sources.comments: Fished anywhere in this zone. There are no schools of these, and they don't occur in schools of other fish. Supposedly they can also be fished from the north sea.

sources.name: The Decrepit Flow
sources.comments: If you want specifically Bonescale Snappers (keeping in mind they are a byproduct of farming other fishies), it seems they are most likely found in this river.

sources.name: Fresh? water
sources.comments: There are no schools of these, and they don't occur in schools of other fish. Found primarily in fresh water, though Wowhead also lists them being caught in ocean water.

sources.name: Borean Man O' War School
sources.comments: The fish is pretty useless as it gets, so there shouldn't be competition on this. Schools of inexplicably non-jellyfish shaped jellyfish can be found along the coast of Borean Tundra.

sources.name: Open salt water: Borean Tundra
sources.comments: Fished from open salt water. While it occurs all around Northrend, it can realistically be farmed only in Borean Tundra and the western part of Dragonblight.

sources.name: Open salt water: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Fished from open salt water. While it occurs all around Northrend, it can realistically be farmed only in Borean Tundra and the western part of Dragonblight.

sources.name: Hardknuckle mobs
sources.comments: These have great drop rates and are easy to kill en masse.

sources.name: Lion Seal Whelp
sources.comments: I wished I was kidding. They have good drop rates, spawn in bunches, and are easy to kill. Get clubbing.

sources.name: Any Northrend animal
sources.comments: You see that animal? It's made of meat. Just go kill it instead of wondering about optimal spots.

sources.name: Deep Sea Monsterbelly School
sources.comments: Only spawn around icebergs off the coast. Luckily they are not relevant to anything practical but achievement hunting, so demand should be low.

sources.name: Deep Sea Monsterbelly School
sources.comments: Only spawn around icebergs off the coast. Luckily they are not relevant to anything practical but achievement hunting, so demand should be low.

sources.name: Deep Sea Monsterbelly School
sources.comments: Only spawn around icebergs off the coast. Luckily they are not relevant to anything practical but achievement hunting, so demand should be low.

sources.name: Dragonfin Angelfish School
sources.comments: Spawn in Dragonblight's rare fresh water exclusively.

sources.name: Water outside the Violet Hold

sources.name: Clams
sources.comments: Find clams on any fishy mob or while fishing.

sources.name: Elwynn Forest
sources.comments: Only relevant and present during the harvest festival. Found absolutely everywhere around the zone, so you need only find a quiet spot.

sources.name: Tirisfal Glades

sources.name: Graymist Hunter
sources.comments: Quest-related but plentiful. See also Duskhowl Prowlers, but there's fewer of them and they are far away.

sources.name: Cavedweller Worg
sources.comments: Found deep in Gimorak's Den northeast of the Engine of the Makers. Gimorak himself is quest-relevant, but the worgs are not. They are not plentiful and take about 5 minutes to respawn. If you are having trouble looting these, first kill the worms they fight and let them reset to full health to get loot credit.

sources.name: Spearfang Worg
sources.comments: There's not many of them and they are quite spread, but they annoyingly slaughter shoveltusks while stealing all the loot, so you'll be doing the world a favour.

sources.name: Fanggore Worg
sources.comments: Share the Rivenwood with spiders. Lots of spiders.

sources.name: Ice Heart Jormungars
sources.comments: Quest-related but plentiful. Will respawn as fast as you kill them. Supposedly have an acid attack that is very deadly but can be mitigated by reading quest text.

sources.name: Infesting Jormungar
sources.comments: Found in Gimorak's Den northeast of the Engine of the Makers.

sources.name: Ravenous Jormungar, Roaming Jormungar
sources.comments: Easy to grab on your questing route for the Sons of Hodir.

sources.name: Jormungar Tunneler
sources.comments: Found on the surface on the west end of the Crystal Vice. They're just having a good time, worming, tunnelling.

sources.name: Smelt Cobalt
sources.comments: 1 Cobalt Ore per bar.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Cobalt Deposit spawn. As far as I've been able to determine, there is nowhere that Rich deposits spawn where regulars don't, or where Rich deposits spawn more often. It seems to spawn everywhere except for the southeast of the snowy region, for lack of rocks.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Howling Fjord
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Cobalt Deposit spawn. As far as I've been able to determine, there is nowhere that Rich deposits spawn where regulars don't, or where Rich deposits spawn more often. Flying is not necessary but advised as the zone's crags hold many spawns. Note the plain areas in the middle have no spawns.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Borean Tundra
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Cobalt Deposit spawn. As far as I've been able to determine, there is nowhere that Rich deposits spawn where regulars don't, or where Rich deposits spawn more often. There are large plains with no spawns. Being able to fly yourself into and out of Coldarra is recommended, but not required.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Dragonblight
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Cobalt Deposit spawn. As far as I've been able to determine, there is nowhere that Rich deposits spawn where regulars don't, or where Rich deposits spawn more often. Since most of the zone is a barren wasteland, the best route is likely to follow the southern and eastern lines and poke into the dragon shrines as you pass.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Grizzly Hills
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Cobalt Deposit spawn. As far as I've been able to determine, there is nowhere that Rich deposits spawn where regulars don't, or where Rich deposits spawn more often. Most nodes in Grizzly Hills are concentrated on the eastern side of the zone as there are many more stark slopes there.

sources.name: Cobalt Deposit: Utgarde Keep
sources.comments: Stealth route: Sneak past the first few packs into the fire room. Pull the chain pulling Vrykul to make the fire despawn. Run through and if possible, pull the second chain puller too and pass his fire. Then vanish. The first deposit is found in the tunnel after Prince Keleseth. It will be necessary to slay a bit of trash to get it, but it's all non-elites except for an elite patrol that can be killed alone or controlled.  Afterwards continue on. Beware the stealth-detecting dogs and randomly leaping Geists. Once on top of the stairs, find the second deposit in the tunnel there, which should be possible to mine while pulling only nonelite trash.  Soloing route: Kill stuff, skip Keleseth if you can't kill him (you should be able to skip him), make your way through. Note that you will have to clear a lot of the dungeon for two nodes, making this potentially unviable even if you can solo the dungeon.

sources.name: Reinforced Crate
sources.comments: Contains a bit of Cobalt ore, a single Frostweave Cloth, or some Borean Leather Scraps.

sources.name: Ormorok the Tree-Shaper
sources.comments: While late on the usual route, could be tackled early.

sources.name: Krystallus
sources.comments: Usually tackled early. His section also features two Saronite nodes, making him not a horrible farm.

sources.name: Forge Construct
sources.comments: Requires defeating the early bosses to access and being in a raid, so you get what you get.

sources.name: Smelt Saronite
sources.comments: 2 Saronite Ore per bar.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Icecrown
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Saronite Deposit spawn. Deposits are found essentially anywhere in the inner basin of the zone (excluding Onslaught Harbor and southwest Jotunheim). Check also the literal saronite mine in Ymirheim.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Sholazar Basin
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Saronite Deposit spawn. Saronite spawns everywhere in the zone, especially its outer rim, except for the Wildgrowth Mangal.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Storm Peaks
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Saronite Deposit spawn. Saronite spawns all around, but don't forget to check the zone's many many caves.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Lake Wintergrasp
sources.comments: Rich deposits replace any regular Saronite Deposit spawn. There seems to be a delicious Saronite pretzel that you can follow, so don't waste time crossing the inside of the loops or the middle south.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Zul'Drak
sources.comments: Rich Saronite Deposits do NOT spawn in Zul'Drak. Regular Saronite Deposits seem to share spawns with Cobalt ones. Otherwise, Saronite follows the same rules of spawning wherever there is a vague outcropping of rock.

sources.name: Saronite Deposit: Halls of Stone
sources.comments: The stealth route has a few tight spots, but is manageable. Take two rights as you enter to reach Krystallus's rock cave. The first Saronite Deposit is on the right side at the entrance of the cave and should be possible to mine by a level 80 standing in the corner. Continuing on, the second deposit is on the left or right side of the entrance in the crystal cave where Krystallus actually resides. Claiming it requires slaying five small nonelite giants and watching out for the patrol of two smalls and an elite iron dwarf.

sources.name: Pure Saronite Deposit
sources.comments: Found in General Vezax's room and definitely guild property.

sources.name: Smelt Titanium
sources.comments: 2 Titanium Ore per bar.

sources.name: Transmute: Titanium
sources.comments: 8 Saronite Ore per bar, plus 20 hours cooldown.

sources.name: Titanium Deposit
sources.comments: Replaces spawns of Rich Saronite Deposit in all places where it appears. Notably NOT in Zul'Drak.

sources.name: Smelt Titansteel
sources.comments: 3 Titanium Bar, 1 Eternal Fire, 1 Eternal Earth, 1 Eternal Shadow per bar, plus 20 hours cooldown.
